publications.name: Quantum free-fall motion and quantum violation of the weak equivalence principle
publications.summary: This study examines how the Weak Equivalence Principle (WEP) — the idea that gravitational and inertial masses are always equal — behaves in the quantum realm. By calculating the time it takes for a particle to reach a specific point under gravity, we found small mass-dependent differences that suggest the WEP doesn't hold perfectly in quantum mechanics. These findings show that quantum effects can lead to a violation of the WEP.
